summary: This is an email chain from November 2021 between an Assistant United States Attorney and others regarding the Maxwell case, discussing the sharing of a Government Exhibit and planning for an in-person meeting. It originates from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of an email on November 8, 2021, copying 'S' to share documents regarding the Maxwell case and requesting a phone discussion.

connections.description: The Assistant U.S. Attorney is copying S to facilitate the sharing of documents related to the Maxwell case.

events.title: Email regarding Maxwell case documents
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails to coordinate sharing documents via USAfx and requests a phone discussion about the Maxwell case.

events.title: Government Exhibit attachment
events.description: An email is sent attaching another Government Exhibit related to the Maxwell case, with a plan to discuss it at the next in-person meeting.

events.title: Confirmation of readiness
events.description: A response email confirms the recipient will review materials and be ready, noting the NYO CART coordinator's contact information.

locations: United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York, One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is an email chain from November 2021 regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
It shows ongoing legal coordination between an Assistant U.S. Attorney and others to share a Government Exhibit.
The correspondence originates from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
It references the use of USAfx for secure document sharing in the case.
The emails plan for both phone and in-person discussions about the case materials.
